result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (9th) and Operating w/ PAC (9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael James Behlke was found guilty of OWI (9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Submit to and comply with an alcohol assessment and comply with driver safety plan.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael James Behlke in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel informs court of plea agreement.  Defendant will plead to Count 1 all other charges will be dismissed.    Judge advises defendant of elements of count 1/max. penalties.  Advised defendant of felony prohibitions.  Defendant pleads no contest to count 1.  Court reviews PLQ/WOR form, advises defendant of his constitutional rights.  Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights & plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of count 1, dismiss counts 2-4.  No request for PSI by counsel.  Letter filed 1/23/15 reviewed by the court.  Court sentences defendant to 5 yrs. in WI State Prison, 3 yrs. IC, 2 yrs. ES.  Conditions of ES:  no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of controlled substance w/o valid prescription; no entrance into bars or taverns w/o advanced written permission of P&P; pay all court ordered obligations; no operation of motor vehicle without valid license or insurance; provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge.
Letter from Rev. C.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 13, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Michael James Behlke in court with attorney Francis X. Rivard.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion resolved.  Matter resolved.  Counsel requests sentencing 90 days out, mandatory sentencing, pleading to OWI 9th.  State will be dismissing other charges.  Defendant agrees to waive JT.  Conditions of release cont'd.  Referred to scheduling clerk.
Motion hearing on January 12, 2015 at 11:30 am.
State's Motion to Impeach the defendant through evidence of prior convictions.
State's Witness List

Jury trial on February 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on January 12, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Jury Trial Scheduling Order:
1.  Trial of this matter is set for jury trial on February 2, 2015.  Time allowed for trial is one day.
2.  The District Attorney will send the Defense Atty their settlement offer prior to the FPT.
3.  The Defense Atty shall review the DA's settlement offer with his/her client prior to the FPT.
4.  A FPT is set for January 12, 2015 at 11:30 a.m.
5.  The Defense Atty, the Defendant, and the District Atty shall all personally appear at the FPT.
Failure of the Defendant to appear personally at the FPT shall result in the cancellation of the trial date and a warrant being issued for the defendant's arrest.
6.  All motions shall be filed in writing and no later than December 17, 2014. ....
If a motion is filed, the filing attorney shall contact the Court and obtain a pretrial motion hearing date.
Notices of alibi and responses shall follow the time limits and other requirements of Sec. 971.23(8) Wis. Stats.
7.  If either side intends to offer expert testimony..., such party shall give written notice to the court and opposing counsel no later than December 17, 2014, of the name, address and qualifications of the expert, the opinions which will be solicited from such expert and the basis for those opinions.
If any party intends to call a rebuttal expert in relation to such expert or testimony that party shall provide the same information as above w/in 15 days of receipt of the notice.  If either side opposes or seeks limitations on such expert testimony, that party shall promptly file a motion to be heard on a date before (but not at) the FPT.
8.  The State and the Defense shall file and serve no later than 5 days before the FPT:
a.  A list ... witnesses.
b.  Any nonstandard substantive or other JI they anticipate they will request be given by the Court.
9 - 10 (See Order in File)
Failure to comply with SCO may subject the attorney and parties to sanctions allowed in 805.03 Wis. Stats., including but not limited to .......

Defendant Michael James Behlke in court with attorney Francis X. Rivard.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to Suppress.  Called & Sworn by State, Officer Samuel Miller.  Cross-Exam by Atty Rivard.  Court finds probable cause, motion to suppress denied.  See scheduling clerk.

Motion hearing on October 27, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Michael James Behlke in court with attorney Francis X. Rivard.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court now receives the Information for filing.  Court advises defendant of elements of each count/max penalties on each as stated in the Complaint and advises defendant of constitutional rights.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Atty Rivard believes he will be filing Motions.  Referred to Scheduling Clerk.

Defendant Michael James Behlke in court with attorney .  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn by the State Officer Samuel J. Miller.  Exhibit 1 O&R. Cross by defense counsel.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  State to file Information.  Atty Rivard informs the court he talked with his client and willing to proceed with Arraignment if the Information is exactly the same as Complaint.
J.S.B. is required to appear on 08/18/2014 @ 3:00 pm
S.M. is required to appear on 08/18/2014 @ 3:00 pm
Preliminary hearing on August 18, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Michael James Behlke in court with attorney Peter J Thompson.  Jon D Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Complaint filed adding BAC.  Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights.  Atty Thompson declines representing Mr. Behlke as he's retiring end of month.  Defendant will be obtaining other counsel.  Defendant agrees Mr. Thompson may w/draw as counsel.  Referred to scheduling clerk to schedule P.H. far enough out for new counsel.
